review.title: “Satisfactory.”
review.pros: Pros – Excellent work-life balance. Nice people.
review.cons: Cons – Horrible training. Poor team-oriented synergy. Management demands communication from staff, but fails to provide properly themselves. Very limited personal interaction. Relationships are not genuine.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – At least try to make time to train your employees and get to know them.

review.title: “Interesting and challenging work that has been rewarded with career advancement”
review.pros: Pros – Receive open & immediate feedback, structured goal setting for career advancement, good training, diverse,friendly people, great perks (wellness program, massages, games with prizes, jeans on Friday)
review.cons: Cons – Long hours during busy season, high stress due to client deadlines, audit & tax departments do not engage as much as you would expect given the size of the firm, half day Friday is not always honored during non busy season.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Great place to enter the public accounting feild”
review.pros: Pros – Numerous opprotunities to learn and get trainingFlexible hours and friendly work environmentAdvancement opportunitiesA variety of projects and the firm is open to allow staff focus on their area of interestConstruction industry niche with the potential to expand in other related areas such as Real estate development, manufacturing, and distribution indstries
review.cons: Cons – Potentail to work in a niche that may not be of interest
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Like a Cult.”
review.pros: Pros – - Staff are allowed to make decisions and are provided more autonomy than at other firms- Clients are very nice- Managers are very technical and know their stuff- Everyone has offices, limited use of cubicles
review.cons: Cons – - The partners can be very mean, at times may yell at you for mistakes. Not just yell, but yell and curse at you.- If you try to leave the firm, the partners may consider it a personal attack rather than a business decision- Compensation is not consistent with Industry- They do primarily Construction, so it requires a specific technical understanding. This also means they have been hit hard by the downturn in this industry. Compensation and benefits reflects this.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Treat your people like people.
